data.title: Our favorite hometown coffee spot!
data.text: When my husband and I recently moved to Clarksville from Italy, we were afraid we'd never find another good cup of coffee again! Thankfully, we were introduced to Hops Java a few months into our move and we have been coffee'ing up there ever since. My husband, a cold brew fiend, raves about their cold brew-- it's so smooth and Hops uses (if memory serves me well) a 5 (or is it 7?) step filtered water system to make the coffee extra good. Their dirty chai latte-- iced or cold-- is my FAVORITE! Hops also gets their pastries from a local bakery and they are killer. The cinnamon rolls, twists, and raspberry danishes are delicious. We love the owner Darla and her crew!

data.title: A charming local coffee shop comparable to Starbucks
data.text:
Overview: A charming little coffee shop with flavor and pricing comparable to Starbucks. (the-honest-traveler.blogspot.com)

The Good: I love Starbucks, but I think I like Hops Java & Juice even more. Why? It's all about buying local.

Not to mention that the food was excellent.  They serve all sorts of coffee shop beverages, smoothies, chips and sandwiches, gluten free baked goods, even treats for your canine!

At the time of my visit, the barista told me that Hops Java & Juice plans to soon incorporate live entertainment into its roster.

Located in a beautiful historic downtown, its a nice place to cool down on a visit to the Clarksville Farmer's Market, held right across the street.

The Bad: I think Starbucks is expensive.  I love it, yes, perhaps I am a coffee addict, but expensive it still remains. The prices at Hops Java & Juice rival those of Starbucks. For example, frappuccinos come in one size, approximately a venti, for about the same price. But I can give them a little slack on the price, as they are a "mom and pop" establishment rather than a chain.

The Delicious: Not only was my frappuccino tasty, but there were some enormous "Big Daddy" cookies calling my name--five inch behemoths filled with chocolate chunks!  This little coffee shop is definitely on my list of places to visit again.

The Confusing: Since the word "hops" was included in the name, I expected to find a microbrewery tucked away inside. No such luck, but there is always the Blackhorse down the street.

data.title: Little Place Downtown to get Ice Cream, Smoothies, Coffee, Etc.
data.text: Visited here after eating at Hops Road, when we realized that the owner's wife had a bakery across the street. We went in, not exactly knowing what to find. It is a very cute cafe with a few places to sit. She has ice cream, coffee and tea, and smoothies. Her smoothies are all natural with no additive base, like orange juice, for example. She also had a great selection of little bars, teas, soaps, and a little area with dog stuff, leashes, dog treats, etc. It was also great to see a little bake case with to go lunches, sandwiches, cheesecake, canoli, cupcakes, etc. The place was very clean, well lit, although the layout was a little weird. The bake case, ice cream, register area was nice. I just thought it was odd that the kitchen area was open, with shelving to divide it. The kitchen area and register/bake case are diagonally across from each other on each side. The owner was very nice and friendly, and very informative when I asked about the smoothies. We had the mint chocolate chip and birthday cake ice cream. It was awesome! Worth a try if your in the downtown area.

data.title: Alternative to Starbucks!
data.text: We visited this restaurant and the other one that they own directly across the street. We enjoy both of these restaurants for their unique menu items and fresh delicious food.

data.title: Brilliant, delicious, super friendly
data.text: Wonderful NEW coffee shop that excels at gluten free and in-house baked goods.  This was perfect for our gluten-sensitive daughter.  The yogurt is outstanding, as is the coffee.  Products are available for purchase.  We ate here every day during our weeklong stay, it was that good!

data.title: Lovely Lunch Spot!
data.text: I absolutely love this place! I come at least 1 time a week with my friends for lunch. They always have new and interesting things on the menu which is good for people like us who like variety. They have a variety of drinks too. The decor is so nice and Sherry the owner is so sweet! I've been for breakfast and lunch many times. I wish Trip Advisor had a button for repeat visits so people knew you didn't come just 1 time.
